bugs.title: CVE-2018-19777 mupdf: infinite loop in the function svg_dev_end_tile in fitz/svg-device.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-19777 mupdf: infinite loop in the function svg_dev_end_tile in fitz/svg-device.c

long_desc.thetext:
In Artifex MuPDF 1.14.0, there is an infinite loop in the function svg_dev_end_tile in fitz/svg-device.c, as demonstrated by mutool. 


References:
https://bugs.ghostscript.com/show_bug.cgi?id=700301

Created mupdf tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1656202]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

bugs.title: CVE-2019-13290 mupdf: heap-based buffer overflow in fz_append_display_node in fitz/list-device.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-13290 mupdf: heap-based buffer overflow in fz_append_display_node in fitz/list-device.c

long_desc.thetext:
Artifex MuPDF 1.15.0 has a heap-based buffer overflow in fz_append_display_node
located at fitz/list-device.c, allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary
code via a crafted PDF file. This occurs with a large BDC property name that
overflows the allocated size of a display list node.

Reference:
http://git.ghostscript.com/?p=mupdf.git;h=ed19bc806809ad10c4ddce515d375581b86ede85
http://git.ghostscript.com/?p=mupdf.git;h=aaf794439e40a2ef544f15b50c20e657414dec7a

Created mupdf tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1727749]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.
